process.sh.content:
#!/bin/sh
# Placeholder. Interface not implemented.
echo "process: interface unavailable"
# What you are looking for isn't here.

procedure_excerpt.txt.content:
Procedure (Excerpt)

1) Receive units from /queue/in
2) Process to container
3) Seal and stage to /queue/out
4) Route non-standard units to /queue/exceptions

Do not describe units in free text.

processing.cfg.content:
MODE=STANDARD
UNIT_CLASS=ASSIGNED
CONTAINER_SIZE=DEFAULT
OUTPUT_PATH=/queue/out
EXCEPTION_ROUTE=/queue/exceptions
NOTE=Use assigned identifiers only

terminology.map.content:
unit=unit
container=container
batch=batch
case=(deprecated)
subject=(do not use)

processing.log.content:
…
[OK] throughput within tolerance
[OK] output sealed
[WARN] identifier format drift observed
…
[OK] resolved without amendment
…

shift_handover.txt.content:
Handover Notes

- Keep the queue steady.
- Don’t open anything.
- If Alignment asks, answer only in codes.

README.txt.content:
Non-standard units routed here.
Do not attempt amendment.
Forward to Exception Handling.

Incoming units are staged here by Intake.
Do not inspect contents.
Do not retain copies.

Output containers are staged here for Consolidation.
Seal and tag per procedure.

readme.txt.content:
PROCESSING TERMINAL

Role: Convert assigned units into containers.
Notes: Do not reference origin. Use assigned identifiers only.
